  • Method
com.teamboid.twitterapi.client

Interface Twitter


  • public interface Twitter
    The main class used within this library, used for performing API actions on Twitter. Use the Authorizer to authenticate an account and get an authorized instance of this class.
    Author:
    Aidan Follestad

      • getFriends

        IDs getFriends(java.lang.String screenName,
             java.lang.Long cursor)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns IDs containing every user the specified user is following.
        Parameters:
        screenName - The screen name of the user for whom to return results for.
        cursorsetMaxId - Causes the list of connections to be broken into pages of no more than 5000 IDs at a time. The number of IDs returned is not guaranteed to be 5000 as suspended users are filtered out after connections are queried. To begin paging provide a value of -1 as the cursor. The response from the API will include a previous_cursor and next_cursor to allow paging back and forth.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getFriends

        IDs getFriends(java.lang.Long userId,
             java.lang.Long cursor)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns IDs containing every user the specified user is following.
        Parameters:
        userId - The ID of the user for whom to return results for.
        cursor - Causes the list of connections to be broken into pages of no more than 5000 IDs at a time. The number of IDs returned is not guaranteed to be 5000 as suspended users are filtered out after connections are queried. To begin paging provide a value of -1 as the cursor. The response from the API will include a previous_cursor and next_cursor to allow paging back and forth.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getFriendshipsIncoming

        IDs getFriendshipsIncoming(java.lang.Long cursor)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns IDs containing every protected user for whom the authenticating user has a pending follow request.
        Parameters:
        cursor - Breaks the results into pages. This is recommended for users who are following many users. Provide a value of -1 to begin paging. Provide values as returned in the response body's next_cursor and previous_cursor attributes to page back and forth in the list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getFriendshipsOutgoing

        IDs getFriendshipsOutgoing(java.lang.Long cursor)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns IDs containing every user who has a pending request to follow the authenticating user.
        Parameters:
        cursor - Breaks the results into pages. This is recommended for users who are following many users. Provide a value of -1 to begin paging. Provide values as returned in the response body's next_cursor and previous_cursor attributes to page back and forth in the list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • reportSpam

        User reportSpam(java.lang.Long userId)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Reports a user for spam, which also blocks the user from the authenticated account.
        Parameters:
        userId - The ID of the user to report.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getBlocking

        User[] getBlocking(java.lang.Long cursor)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns an array of user objects that the authenticating user is blocking. Consider using getBlockingIds(Long) with lookupUsers(Long[]) instead of this method.
        Parameters:
        cursor - Causes the list of users to be broken into pages of no more than 5000 IDs at a time. The number of IDs returned is not guaranteed to be 5000 as suspended users are filtered out after connections are queried. To begin paging provide a value of -1 as the cursor. The response from the API will include a previous_cursor and next_cursor to allow paging back and forth. If the cursor is not provided the API will attempt to return all IDs. For users with many blockings this will probably fail.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getBlockingIds

        IDs getBlockingIds(java.lang.Long cursor)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns an IDs containing user IDs that the authenticating user is blocking.
        Parameters:
        cursor - Causes the list of users to be broken into pages of no more than 5000 IDs at a time. The number of IDs returned is not guaranteed to be 5000 as suspended users are filtered out after connections are queried. To begin paging provide a value of -1 as the cursor. The response from the API will include a previous_cursor and next_cursor to allow paging back and forth. If the cursor is not provided the API will attempt to return all IDs. For users with many blockings this will probably fail.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • existsBlock

        boolean existsBlock(java.lang.String screenName)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns if the authenticating user is blocking a target user.
        Parameters:
        screenName - The screen name of the user to check if the authenticated user has blocked.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        java.lang.Exception

      • createBlock

        User createBlock(java.lang.String screenName)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Blocks the specified user from following the authenticating user. In addition the blocked user will not show in the authenticating users mentions or timeline (unless retweeted by another user). If a follow or friend relationship exists it is destroyed.
        Parameters:
        screenName - The screen name of the user to block.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • createBlock

        User createBlock(java.lang.Long userId)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Blocks the specified user from following the authenticating user. In addition the blocked user will not show in the authenticating users mentions or timeline (unless retweeted by another user). If a follow or friend relationship exists it is destroyed.
        Parameters:
        userId - The ID of the user to block.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • destroyBlock

        User destroyBlock(java.lang.String screenName)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Un-blocks the specified user for the authenticating user. Returns the un-blocked user in the requested format when successful. If relationships existed before the block was instated, they will not be restored.
        Parameters:
        screenName - The screen name of the user to unblock.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • destroyBlock

      • createList

        UserList createList(java.lang.String name,
                  UserListMode mode,
                  java.lang.String description)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Creates a new list for the authenticated user. Note that you can't create more than 20 lists per account.
        Parameters:
        name - The name for the list. A list's name must start with a letter and can consist only of 25 or fewer letters, numbers, "-", or "_" characters.
        mode - Whether your list is public or private.
        description - The description to give the list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • createListMembers

        void createListMembers(long listId,
                     long[] userIds)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds multiple members to a list, by specifying a comma-separated list of member ids or screen names. The authenticated user must own the list to be able to add members to it. Note that lists can't have more than 500 members, and you are limited to adding up to 100 members to a list at a time with this method.

        Please note that there can be issues with lists that rapidly remove and add memberships. Take care when using these methods such that you are not too rapidly switching between removals and adds on the same list.
        Parameters:
        listId - The ID of the list to add members to.
        userIds - The IDs of users to add to the list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • createListMembers

        void createListMembers(long listId,
                     java.lang.String[] screenNames)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds multiple members to a list, by specifying a comma-separated list of member ids or screen names. The authenticated user must own the list to be able to add members to it. Note that lists can't have more than 500 members, and you are limited to adding up to 100 members to a list at a time with this method.

        Please note that there can be issues with lists that rapidly remove and add memberships. Take care when using these methods such that you are not too rapidly switching between removals and adds on the same list.
        Parameters:
        listId - The ID of the list to add members to.

        java.lang.Exception

      • getTrendsAvailable

        TrendLocation[] getTrendsAvailable(GeoLocation location)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns the locations that Twitter has trending topic information for.

        The response is an array of "locations" that encode the location's WOEID and some other human-readable information such as a canonical name and country the location belongs in.
        Parameters:
        location - The coordinates to sort the results (from close to far) with.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
